business.headline: 90-hour workweek: What India Inc thinks of L&T chief's suggestionL&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan recently expressed regret over not being able to make employees work on Sundays, suggesting that a 90-hour workweek is key to success.

Industry leaders call for up to 90-hour workweek. Are they willing to pay more? L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan made waves by suggesting employees should work on Sundays. Last year, Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy proposed that millennials work 70-hour weeks to improve India's productivity.
Budget 2025: Don't expect these tax changesBudget 2025 is likely to prioritise fiscal discipline, minor tax tweaks, and cautious consumption boosts over bold reforms.

Rupee hits all-time low, nears 86 mark against US dollarRupee hits all-time: Closing at 85.9650, the rupee marked its tenth consecutive weekly loss, slipping 0.2% this week amid a strong dollar and persistent capital outflows.
Sensex, Nifty close lower amid earnings concerns; TCS gains 6% The S&P BSE Sensex lost 241.30 points to end at 77,378.91, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 95 points to end at 23,431.50.

Blinkit launches Bistro app for 10-minute food deliveryBlinkit's Bistro delivers canteen-style food in 10 minutes, rivalling Swiggy's Snacc and Zepto Cafe.

Sensex, Nifty in volatile territory: What should stock market investors do? Stock market today: Sensex and Nifty rebounded on IT gains, but volatility persists amid FII outflows and global uncertainty. Here's what's driving the market and how investors should tackle it.

Budget 2025: What is joint taxation for married couples?The ICAI's Budget 2025 proposal for joint taxation of married couples aims to ease financial stress, boost compliance, and modernise India's tax system with higher exemptions and flexible slabs.

Tata Elxsi share price down 8%. Why did it hit 52-week low after Q3 results?Tata Elxsi stock price: At 10:40 a.m., Tata Elxsi's share price was down 7% at Rs 5992.95. In early trade, the stock hit a 52-week low of Rs 5,924.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 'Not a contender for any post': Ramesh Bidhuri counters Arvind Kejriwal's claimDelhi BJP leader Ramesh Bidhuri on Sunday refuted former Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's claim that he is the party's candidate for the Chief Minister's post in the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections.

IPL 2025 to start on March 21, final on May 25: Rajeev ShuklaThe IPL 2025 season will kick off on March 21, with major decisions made at the latest BCCI meeting, including the appointment of a new treasurer and secretary. The auction saw top players like Rishabh Pant breaking records with massive bids.

Such arrogance not good: Governor's office to MK Stalin amid national anthem rowTamil Nadu Raj Bhavan hit back at Chief Minister MK Stalin for his "childish" remark at Governor RN Ravi amid the national anthem row, saying that such arrogance was not good, and the "brazen insult" to Constitution won't be tolerated.

Took my pistol and went to Kapil Dev's house to kill him: Yograj SinghYuvraj Singh's father Yograj has revealed that he went to Kapil Dev's house to kill him. Yograj said that he took out his pistol wanting to put a bullet through Kapil's head.

Underwater drones, AI-powered cameras: UP Police goes hi-tech for Mahakumbh  2025In a first, the authorities will be using underwater drones, providing real-time surveillance, especially when millions of devotees throng the ghats to take a dip at the Sangam.

5 killed, 17 injured after bus loses control, overturns in UttarakhandUpon receiving the information about the accident, Pauri Garwhal district officials, State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) and police teams left for the spot.

Fraudsters swap QR codes outside shops to get payments into their accountsFraudsters in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur replaced QR codes at shops overnight, diverting payments to their accounts. The crime, caught on CCTV, is under investigation.

BJP will raze Delhi slums if it wins polls: Arvind Kejriwal counters Amit ShahAfter visiting slums in Delhi's Shakur Basti, AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal said the BJP does not love slum dwellers and considers them "insects".

My wife loves staring at me on Sundays: Adar Poonawalla's dig at 90-hour workweekSerum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla took a jibe at the ongoing 90-hour workweek. In a post on X, he tagged industrialist Anand Mahindra and said "My wife loves staring at me on Sundays."

Pickleball serves new business idea, merges passion with profitsThe pickleball rage in India has taken a new turn. The US-born game, which entered the sports scene in India just four years ago, has opened up a new investment option, promising big returns. Congress offers Rs 8,500 to Delhi's educated unemployed youth in new schemeThe Congress announced another scheme called 'Yuva Udaan Yojana', promising to give Rs 8,500 per month for one year to the educated unemployed youth of Delhi if it was voted to power in the upcoming Assembly elections.

sports.headline: WPL 2025 to be hosted in Mumbai, Vadodara, Lucknow and Bengaluru: Rajeev ShuklaThe WPL 2025 will be held across 4 cities, BCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla confirmed on Sunday, January 12. Mumbai, Lucknow, Bengaluru and Vadodara will act as the venues for the women's franchise league this year.

Jemimah Rodrigues hits maiden international hundred, completes 1000 ODI runs Jemimah Rodrigues' maiden ODI century and 1000 runs milestone led India to a record-breaking total of 358/4. With a stellar partnership alongside Deol, Rodrigues anchored India's innings, capping off an explosive finish that left Ireland with a daunting target.

Powered by Jemimah's hundred, India post their highest-ever total in ODIsIndia Women, led by Smriti Mandhana, posted a record-breaking 370/5 in the second ODI against Ireland, powered by Jemimah Rodrigues' maiden century and dominant top-order batting, surpassing their previous best total set in 2017.

Rohit and Kohli, both in the wrong side of 30s were underperformers in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2024/25.

Who is Devajit Saikia? Ex-Assam cricketer replaces Jay Shah as BCCI secretaryFrom the cricket field to the corridors of power, Assam's Devajit Saikia brings a unique blend of experience as he takes over as BCCI secretary, succeeding Jay Shah, who now leads the ICC as its chairman.

Ibrahimovic on Marcus Rashford transfer to AC Milan: Not an easy dealZlatan Ibrahimovic acknowledges AC Milan's ambitious pursuit of Manchester United star Marcus Rashford but admits the transfer poses challenges. Despite competition from Europe's elite, Milan remains determined to bring the English forward to bolster their attacking lineup.

Perth Scorcher's pacer Jhye Richardson opts out of BBL due to shoulder surgeryJhye Richardson has opted for shoulder surgery, ending his BBL season with Perth Scorchers. The 28-year-old pacer aims to regain full fitness for the 2025-26 Ashes, prioritizing long-term stability after years of recurring shoulder injuries.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP.
